attributes.action: Strip Sir Christopher Chope of his knighthood
attributes.additional_details:
Sir Christopher Chope has a history of blocking or objecting to proposals based upon his own personal views, rather then what is the for the good of the people. As an MP, his primary obligation is to do what is right for the people of the UK. Some examples include

- Blocking the new law to make it illegal to take photo's up a skirt
- Objecting the pardon on Alan Turning
- Objecting to Hillsborough debate
- Proposed abolishing minimum wage
- Voted against same sex marriage
attributes.background: Sir Christopher Chope has once again voted against a law that if passed would help protect our society, based upon his own personal view rather than what is good for the people of the UK.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture

If you'd like the procedure of objecting to Bills to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/222338

If you'd like the law on upskirting to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/216290
